name: createBlockchain
desc: Create a new blockchain. Currently only supports the creation of new instances of the AVM and the Timestamp VM.

params.name: subnetID
params.desc: `subnetID` is the ID of the Subnet that validates the new blockchain. The Subnet must exist and can’t be the Primary Network.

params.name: vmID
params.desc: `vmID` is the ID of the Virtual Machine the blockchain runs. Can also be an alias of the Virtual Machine.

params.name: name
params.desc: `name` is a human-readable name for the new blockchain. Not necessarily unique.

params.name: genesisData
params.desc: `genesisData` is the byte representation of the genesis state of the new blockchain encoded in the format specified by the `encoding` parameter.

params.name: encoding
params.desc: `encoding` specifies the format to use for `genesisData`. Can be either “cb58” or “hex”. Defaults to “cb58”. Virtual Machines should have a static API method named `buildGenesis` that can be used to generate `genesisData`

params.name: from
params.desc: `from` are the addresses that you want to use for this operation. If omitted, uses any of your addresses as needed.

params.name: changeAddr
params.desc: `changeAddr` is the address any change will be sent to. If omitted, change is sent to one of the addresses controlled by the user.

params.name: username
params.desc: `username` is the user that pays the transaction fee. This user must have a sufficient number of the subnet’s control keys.
